studies.indication: Evaluation of carotid artery stenosis, vertebral artery pathology, suspected vascular malformation, neck trauma with vascular injury, pre-surgical planning for neck procedures, or assessment of post-operative vascular complications.
Suspected brain tumor, metastases, infection (abscess, encephalitis), inflammatory conditions, enhancement of known lesions, post-operative surveillance, or when MRI is contraindicated.

Suspected facial soft tissue mass, infection, inflammatory conditions, post-operative complications, evaluation of dental pathology with soft tissue involvement, or TMJ disorders with soft tissue component.

studies.study: CT NECK SOFT TISSUE W/ CONTRAST

Suspected spinal infection, tumor, post-operative complications, enhancement of known lesions, or when MRI is contraindicated in patients with neurological symptoms.
Acute trauma with suspected fracture, cervical spondylosis, degenerative changes, bone pathology, or when rapid imaging is needed for unstable patients.
Suspected spinal infection, tumor, post-operative surveillance, enhancement of known lesions, or when MRI is contraindicated in patients with radiculopathy.
Lumbar spine trauma, degenerative disc disease, spondylolisthesis, bone pathology, or when rapid imaging is needed for acute back pain with neurological deficits.
Suspected spinal infection, tumor, post-operative complications, enhancement of known lesions, or when MRI is contraindicated in patients with thoracic myelopathy.
Thoracic spine trauma, compression fractures, degenerative changes, bone pathology, or when rapid imaging is needed for chest wall or thoracic back pain.
Hearing loss, temporal bone trauma, chronic otitis media, cholesteatoma, tinnitus, vertigo, or pre-surgical planning for cochlear implants.
Suspected temporal bone infection, tumor, vascular malformation, post-operative complications, or when enhancement of soft tissue structures is needed.
Suspected cerebral venous sinus thrombosis, venous malformation, increased intracranial pressure of unknown cause, or when MRV is contraindicated.
Suspected intracranial aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation, stroke evaluation, headache with vascular etiology, or screening in high-risk patients.
Carotid artery stenosis, stroke or TIA evaluation, neck bruit, pre-operative vascular assessment, or follow-up of known vascular disease.
Brachial plexus injury, thoracic outlet syndrome, Pancoast tumor, radiation plexopathy, or evaluation of arm weakness and numbness.
Suspected brain tumor, metastases, infection, inflammatory conditions, multiple sclerosis, post-operative surveillance, or detailed enhancement evaluation.
Headache evaluation, seizure workup, cognitive decline, stroke, developmental delay, trauma, or screening when contrast is not indicated.
Suspected acoustic neuroma, hearing loss, tinnitus, facial nerve paralysis, cerebellopontine angle mass, or retrocochlear pathology.
Initial evaluation of hearing loss, tinnitus, vertigo, or when contrast enhancement is not required for inner ear assessment.
Neck mass evaluation, thyroid pathology, cervical lymphadenopathy, soft tissue trauma, or when contrast is contraindicated.
Suspected orbital tumor, thyroid eye disease, optic neuritis, orbital infection, proptosis, or vision changes requiring detailed enhancement evaluation.
Suspected pituitary adenoma, hyperpituitarism, hypopituitarism, galactorrhea, amenorrhea, visual field defects, or endocrine dysfunction.
Cervical radiculopathy, myelopathy, disc herniation, spinal stenosis, degenerative changes, or evaluation of neck pain with neurological symptoms.

Thoracic myelopathy, disc disease, spinal stenosis, thoracic back pain with neurological symptoms, or evaluation of spinal cord pathology.
Suspected cerebral venous sinus thrombosis, venous malformation, idiopathic intracranial hypertension, or evaluation of venous drainage patterns.
Comprehensive stroke evaluation, suspected aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation, carotid stenosis, or when complete cerebrovascular assessment is needed.
Acute stroke evaluation, suspected intracranial aneurysm, arteriovenous malformation, vasculitis, or when rapid vascular imaging is needed.
Facial trauma, fractures, dental pathology, TMJ disorders, bone pathology, or pre-surgical planning when soft tissue detail is not required.

Inner ear pathology, sudden sensorineural hearing loss, Meniere's disease, labyrinthitis, or when detailed soft tissue evaluation of the temporal bone is needed.

Abdominal mass evaluation, liver lesion characterization, renal pathology, or when contrast is contraindicated but detailed soft tissue imaging is needed.

Suspected pancreatic cancer, pancreatitis evaluation, pancreatic cysts, endocrine tumors, or abdominal pain with pancreatic etiology.
Suspected prostate cancer, elevated PSA, abnormal digital rectal exam, biopsy planning, or active surveillance of known prostate cancer.

Infertility evaluation, fallopian tube patency assessment, recurrent pregnancy loss, or suspected uterine anomalies.

Cancer staging, metastatic disease evaluation, trauma assessment, or comprehensive evaluation of multiple body regions.

Suspected hepatocellular carcinoma, liver metastases, hepatic lesion characterization, or detailed evaluation of enhancing liver masses.
